title: I'm only 4 months into League, & already understand people's complaints...
body:
**EVERYONE'S** talking about there's too much true damage, too much damage overall, tower's are squishy, little to no counter-play to some characters, ADC's receiving a punishment that was too harsh, supports being unable to save the nerfed ADC's, jungle changes didn't work for the best, Baron is too weak, Rift herald hits towers too hard, domination / assassin classes running wild one-shotting everything, games are too short, snowball is out of control, developers wont listen to a thing, and just unnecessary changes overall... the list goes on and on.

I've witnessed if not all, most of these changes in **only 4 months of playing**.  Honestly, It's actually pretty insane.


I do like league a lot, and i'm so new to the game - my opinion probably shouldn't matter compared to those who've been playing since like season 2..
But these changes are really affecting the game way too much - and unfortunately according to _most players_ - not for the better. 

I do hope something can be done about it!

replies.body: Want to know the sad part?  Some of those things that people are complaining about (short games, snowball, assassins) were fixed two or three seasons ago.  Makes you wonder where Riot tripped and hit their head with some of these changes.

tank meta and riot comming with the genius idea that damage = fun. if anything it did help the LCS become more active though so that's a plus point i guess but like most people agree on, the LCS plays an entirely different game than the rest of us. their games are slower because every person on that team has synergy and works together, a luxury you dont get in regular league.

there always champs that are better at something.
stop circle jerking around. was that correct? lol

yeah except there aren't people that enchant better than enchanters, there aren't people that tank better than tanks, there aren't really non-marksmen that have the range marksmen do, but there are like 20 characters that 1 shot better than assassins. That's why it's a circle jerk to complain about assassins. Assassins quality is mobility, not 1 shot-ness. no one is as mobile as most assassins, but to complain about damage is a circle jerk when Caitlyn and Draven 1 shot auto attack people, and there are many better burst CC combos in the fighter or mage tree that have no counterplay for 100-0 damage. The only reason people notice assassin 1 shots, is because they get as fed as anyone else does, but then they have high incombat flashy mobility to use it, normally to kill a backline adc or support(the squishest people on the team.) Confusing this quality as being able to one shot verses mobility just means you circle jerk boards and don't really understand the game. 

The way Assassins scale is also legitimately normally a joke. They don't 1 shot anything level 18 without becoming insanely fed. Their entire purpose is to win early-mid-game. Katarina literally buys TWO flat magic pen items, mejais, and gunblades, this is to win the game at under 20 minutes. She does 'high damage' early game, because she is itemizing the highest damage items early game possible, that fall off faster than any other stat in the game. Talon with his Lethality rushes is the exact same. You literally just buy cloth armor(or null mantle), and he has wasted 1100 gold to your 300, and he loses his entire early game power spike for nothing and you gain 5 armor for free. The counter play to assassins is the easiest one in the game. It's not uncommon for people to buy cloth armor(zhoyna) against Zed just right off the bat at the start of the game, and this shuts his ass down pretty well on just about anyone, because his early game sudden impact is shot, building duskblade into armor hurts, and then you get the fastest possible completed zhoyna. I have trouble thinking of a single assassin that isn't effected by early game armor itemization heavily, with the exception of master yi, the true damage assassin, but he is technically never '1shoting' anyone, he autos you down. Even then, armor is strong against his ass too.

Every role in the game has a '1 shot'.

Meanwhile you realize Wukong builds full lethality (aka ASSASSIN) while he was supposed to be a fighter. Do you really want to compare getting oneshotted from stealth to getting hit by full Talyiah combo (that DOESN'T one shot you in lane phase by the way, and I got hit by it that way more than I should have if my dodging ability didn't suck ). 
For everyone does too much damage it's exactly what we're complaining about. Assassin needing even more of it to justify being picked

assassins have mobility, there was never a point where they were the best at one shotting. the circle jerk just continues. annie is the 8 season reigning champion of 1 shots. Next would be syndra. The first assassin would be 20 spaces down(Talon). The fact Wukong(a Fighter) is better at one shotting than katarina _when he builds assassin_ is not surprising at all, because he cannot shunpo(a spell 2x the distance of flash) 3 times, per kill, for a total of 30 flashes of distance in a teamfight.

They weren't the best at oneshotting because THEY ARE NOT SUPPOSED TO ONE-SHOT. Their quality is mobility and roam potential (or was). Wukong building full lethality to one shot is just sad because if he didn't he would be blown up anyway so might as well maximize damage. I am not saying assassins in particular do too much damage , I'm saying EVERYONE does too much damage, so they have to be able to one shot or they get oneshotted. I don't know what you mean by circle jerk and why you feel attacked for a gameplay opinion  :/
Pantheon is an assassin tho. -_-
Thats why he comes up under fighter, and has tank stats with damage. Because he is an assassin -_-. Is aatrox an assassin too? -_-
